recordTypes.name: Code Violation
recordTypes.description: This record submittal type is for any items or issues of concern that ARE NOT related to vehicles, building, trash/debris, septic and wells or zoning related.

recordTypes.name: Oversized/Overweight/Trip Permits
1. Signing Up, Creating a Profile & Accessing Your Information
recordTypes.description: Instructions on signing up for a ViewPoint Cloud Account and how to access your profile and records.

recordTypes.name: 2. Applying for a Permit & Paying Fees
recordTypes.description: How to apply for a permit and pay any fees that are due.

recordTypes.name: Well Sample Testing Request
recordTypes.description:
This Record request is for Water Sampling of Private Drinking Wells Only throughout Polk County. 

For Additional Information you may visit the IDNR site at - https://www.iowadnr.gov/environmental-protection/water-quality/private-well-program/well-testing. 

If you are on a Public Water Supply and would like to have your water tested please contact your water provider.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Violation
recordTypes.description: Separate from other code violations, zoning violation forms are for use by planning staff to record progress within enforcement activities pertaining to illegal uses, businesses, etc.

recordTypes.name: Compliance - Air Quality Request
recordTypes.description: Report an Air Quality concern. May remain anonymous.

recordTypes.name: 3. Receiving Your Permit or Other Document
recordTypes.description: How to view and print your issued permit, license, or other issued document.

recordTypes.name: Construction Permit Application - Spray Booth Permit-by-Rule
recordTypes.description:
Permit-by-Rule (PBR) for spray booths. 
Facilities that facility-wide spray more than 3 gallons/day are not eligible to use the permit by rule for spray booths (see PCBHRR Chapter V Section 5-28.1).

recordTypes.name: Septic Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit record type is for the installation, alteration, modification, and of Septic Systems for new and existing systems. This permit covers abandonment of existing system if existing system is being replaced. If scope of work is to abandon only, please submit Septic Abandon Permit

recordTypes.name: Code Violation - Trash/Debris
recordTypes.description: This violation type is for Trash and Debris located on a property. If other concerns are present on the property please list them in the comments section of the complaint form.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Conditional Use Permits are required for certain uses within a given zoning district. Please contact staff for more information if a proposed use would require a conditional use permit.

recordTypes.name: Construction Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Review of Construction plans for street and utility extensions.

recordTypes.name: Septic Abandonment Only Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit record type is for the abandonment of the Septic system ONLY. If replacing the existing Septic system the permit for that work covers the abandonment of the existing system.

recordTypes.name: Permit Determination Application
recordTypes.description: Regulatory applicability determination.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Development Permit
recordTypes.description: Flood Plain Development Permits are required to develop, alter, or preform work, including flood protection works, in a flood plain.  All such work shall be done in accordance with the requirements of the Zoning Ordinance for the Unincorporated Polk County, Iowa, Article 7, Division 4, Section 1. Floodplains and with all other applicable County ordinances and the laws and regulations of the State of Iowa.

recordTypes.name: Well Permit - New
recordTypes.description: A well permit is required to be obtained from the County if a water well permit is not required by the State of Iowa. No water well for which a County permit is required shall be installed or reconstructed until an application has been submitted and permit issued by Polk County.

recordTypes.name: Code Violation - Building
recordTypes.description: This violation type is for building and building code related items including abandoned or dilapidated structures, fire damaged structures, etc. If other concerns are present on the property, please list them in the comments section of the complaint form.

recordTypes.name: Code Violation - Environmental Health
recordTypes.description: This violation type is for Septic and Well systems, permits required, and other environmental health related items. If other concerns are present on the property, please list them in the comments section of the complaint form.

recordTypes.name: Binding Waiver Agreement
recordTypes.description: This record type is for submittals for Binding Waivers for demolition, future installations or weather as allowed per IAC 567-69 (2).

recordTypes.name: Permit Rescission Request
recordTypes.description: Request to rescind a construction permit and/or an operating permit.

recordTypes.name: Grading & Site Improvement Permit
recordTypes.description: A site improvement permit is required to begin grading and/or site improvement construction associated with an approved site plan or approved grading plan. Site improvement permits are required when no new building construction is taking place. Any property or development site to conduct land-disturbing activities including fill in excess of three (3) feet, or excavation exceeding five (5) feet, or work that involves greater than 50 cubic yards of excavation, or fill or any grading or clearing activity that disturbs an area five thousand (5,000) square feet or greater within unincorporated Polk County shall obtain a permit prior to any land-disturbing activities.

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Permit
recordTypes.description: All home occupations require a permit. The home occupation must be clearly subordinate to the residential use of the property. A completed application with a diagram of dwelling or garage is required for a submittal.

recordTypes.name: Code Violation - Junk Vehicles
recordTypes.description: This violation type is for Junk Vehicles on Private property. If other concerns are present on the property please list them in the comments section of the complaint form.

recordTypes.name: Private Well Grant
recordTypes.description:
For Private Well Grant Reimbursement requests. 
Well Reconstruction or Renovation
Well Water Tests
Well Assessment
Shock Chlorination
Well Closure/Plugging

recordTypes.name: Major Site Plan
recordTypes.description: A major site plan is required prior to the development of a site for non-residential uses permitted or conditional or planned residential uses, a site plan shall be submitted and shall conform to the requirements as outlined in Article 14 of the Polk County Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Pole Barn Permit - Residential Only
recordTypes.description:
This permit is for the construction of "Pole Type" Structures utilized for accessory residential structures such as detached garages/sheds/pavilions/etc. 

For "Barndominiums" or "ADU's" please submit a New Single Family Dwelling permit. For commercial/industrial structures please submit a New Commercial building permit.

recordTypes.name: Registration - CI Engine <400bhp
recordTypes.description: Registration for stationary compression ignition internal combustion engines less than 400 brake horsepower.

recordTypes.name: Minor Preliminary Plat
recordTypes.description: Minor Preliminary Plat

recordTypes.name: Minor Final Plat
recordTypes.description: Minor Final Plat

recordTypes.name: Registration - SI Engine <400bhp
recordTypes.description: Registration for stationary spark ignition internal combustion engines less than 400 brake horsepower.

recordTypes.name: Residential New Dwelling/House Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit record type is for new single family homes including bi-attached homes, ADU's, manufactured/modular homes and "pole-barn" type homes also known as "barndominiums".

Please also use this permit type for moving/relocating homes within the County from one place to another or into the County as well as manufactured/mobile homes into a community park.

recordTypes.name: Minor Site Plan
recordTypes.description:
A Minor Site Plan is allowed when there is an existing site plan on file and the following: 
* Addition to an existing non-residential building 
or
* Expansion of a non-residential use which includes, but is not limited to, the addition of paved surfaces or outdoor storage areas
or
* Unmanned utility substation 
or
* New non-residential use on a property where a change of use permit is required

recordTypes.name: Sketch Plan
recordTypes.description:
A Sketch Plan is a scaled drawing that is not required to be certified due to the
minimal changes to an existing site and is allowed when one of the following
conditions exist:

recordTypes.name: Major Final Plat
recordTypes.description:
A subdivision plat for five or more lots within a tract of record. 

The Major Final Plat will be reviewed and approved upon satisfactory compliance with the Comprehensive Plan, Zoning Ordinance and pertinent Subdivision Ordinance regulations.

recordTypes.name: Sound Equipment Permit
recordTypes.description: No person shall use operate or cause to be used or operated any sound equipment upon the public streets or in any building or upon any premises, public or private, if the sound therefrom be plainly audible from any public street or public place within the county, unless said person first obtains a permit in accordance with this section; complies with the condition imposed by the permit including the maximum permitted sound level shown therein; and complies with all other applicable provisions of the Polk County Noise Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Reporting - Performance Test
recordTypes.description: For reporting of performance tests including (but not limited to): stack testing as a result of  a construction permit requirement, stack testing as a result of an operating permit requirement, NESHAP test reporting (e.g. ZZZZ testing), NSPS test reporting (e.g. JJJJ testing), product/material test reporting, or other compliance demonstrations.

recordTypes.name: Residential Addition to Dwelling/House Permit
Plat of Survey
recordTypes.description:
Plat of Survey shall be prepared in accordance with Chapter 354 and 355 of the Iowa
Code for the division of a “Tract of Record” into two parts that does not dedicate street
right-of way or land reserved for public use

recordTypes.name: Residential Interior Alterations/Foundation Repair/Egress Window Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit record is for Interior Alterations including Fire/Water Damage, Finishing of Basement, Foundation Repairs and Installation of Egress Windows

recordTypes.name: Reporting - Small Unit Exemption (SUE) Justification Document
recordTypes.description: An owner or operator that utilizes the small unit exemption as specified in PCBHRR Chapter V, Article X, Section 5-33(63) must maintain on-site an exemption justification document.

recordTypes.name: Residential Detached Garage/Shed/Acc Bldg Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit is for the construction of detached garages/sheds or similar accessory structures that are "TRADITIONALLY " framed meaning "STICK-BUILT".

Please also use this permit type for moving/relocating existing detached garages within the County from one place to another or into the County.

recordTypes.name: Secondary Meter
recordTypes.description: Secondary Meters on DMWW

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: A sign permit is required for the erection, alteration, or relocation of any sign in the unincorporated areas of Polk County. The repainting, changing of parts, and preventative maintenance of signs located on the site shall not be deemed alterations requiring a Sign Permit.

recordTypes.name: Variance Request - Construction Permitting Air Quality Only
recordTypes.description:
Application for a construction permitting variance. 
**This is only for Air Quality equipment, not for a building variance.**

recordTypes.name: Sanitary Sewer Connection Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for Polk County Residential or Commercial/Industrial Sanitary Sewer Connection Permit

recordTypes.name: Variance Appeal Application
recordTypes.description:
The Polk County Board of Adjustment is empowered by Iowa law and by the Zoning Ordinance of Polk County to hear requests and to make decisions on variance appeals to the Zoning Ordinance for individual properties where provisions of the Ordinance impose a unique and unnecessary hardship on the property owner and where the granting of a variance is not contrary to the intent of the Zoning Ordinance or to the public interest. 

Each variance appeal is only a request to have a hearing before the Board of Adjustment. Notice of the hearing will be provided to all property owners located within 250 feet from the subject property.  The Board of Adjustment will make a determination at a public hearing whether or not to approve or deny the request based on a staff report, applicant presentation, as well as public input.  All appeals that are denied shall not come back to the Board of Adjustment for one year.  Refunds will not be made once notice has been sent out to adjacent property owners.

recordTypes.name: Comprehensive Plan Amendment and Rezoning Application
recordTypes.description:
A submittal is only a request to have the Comprehensive Plan amendment and/or Zoning
Map change reviewed at a public hearing before the Zoning Commission. The Zoning
Commission reviews the requested Comprehensive Plan amendment and/or Zoning Map
change at a public hearing making a recommendation based on a staff report, applicant
presentation, as well as public input. The Zoning Commission recommendation is considered
by the Board of Supervisors at a public hearing on the request. Notice of each public hearing
is published in the official county newspapers and individual notice will be mailed to all
property owners located within 500 feet of the subject property. Requests that are denied
shall not come back to the Board of Supervisors for one year. Refunds will not be made once
notice has been sent out to adjacent property owners.

recordTypes.name: Reporting - Bulk Gasoline Plant Reporting (NESHAP BBBBBB)
recordTypes.description: NESHAP Reporting - Bulk Gasoline Plant Reporting (NESHAP BBBBBB)

recordTypes.name: Easement Vacation
recordTypes.description: A request to vacate a portion of an existing public utility, drainage, or other publicly established easement.

categories.name: Air Quality
categories.content: If you are looking for the Responsible Official Registration, it has been removed.

categories.name: Building Permits
categories.content:
The Polk County Building Department reviews plans, issues permits and inspects building construction located within the unincorporated areas of the County. The 2021 International Codes have been adopted for Residential, Commercial and Industrial projects. Required permits can range from decks and pools to factories, storage facilities, chemical/fuel tanks and more. The County has also adopted the State Plumbing, Mechanical, Electrical and Energy Codes. 

*

categories.name: Code Violations/Enforcement
categories.content:
Code Enforcement investigates and enacts enforcement of properties in violation of the Zoning and Health Nuisance Ordinances in an effort to eliminate conditions that threaten the life, health, safety and general welfare of the community. 

Polk County has adopted a Health Nuisance Regulation that assists in keeping properties cleaned up in the unincorporated areas of the County. If you have junk, debris, unlicensed and/or inoperable vehicles on your property yo

categories.name: Environmental Health Services
categories.content:
Environmental Health Services Division provides services related to those affecting the health and safety to the physical environment in which we live. 

Services include:
* Permitting and Inspections of On-Site Wastewater Treatment Systems (OWTS) 
* Review of Time of Transfer (TOT) Inspection Reports for Private On-site Water Treatment Systems
* Private Well inspections for New and Abandoned Wells throughout the County

categories.name: Fire Inspection Services
categories.content: <div>Fire Department Services for unincorporated Polk County are served mostly by volunteer Township Fire Departments. The two main active Township Fire Departments are Saylor and Delaware. The <u>Polk County Building Department</u> performs plan reviews, inspections and issues permits for Fire Protection Systems and Fire Code related items. Polk County has adopted the 2021 International Fire Code with amendments per Polk County Construction Code Chapter 20 (<a href="http://chrome-extension%3A//

categories.content:
Please use this form to report the following:

Dead Deer
Drainage Repair

Intersection Light Repair
Junk in Ditch
Mailbox Repair (due to snow removal only)
New Road Sign Installation
Pot Hole

Roadway Repair
